Open positions

The Romano Lab is newly established and actively recruiting in a number of areas. Listed below are positions we are currently trying to fill, but please don't hesitate to reach out if you would like to work with us and don't fit any of the categories specifically outlined.

PhD Students:

We're looking for new PhD students with interests in any of the following areas: Translational bioinformatics, computational toxicology, biomedical ontologies, graph machine learning, clinical informatics, cheminformatics, natural product drug discovery, or related fields. PhD students in the lab are expected to publish papers and present their work at national and international conferences.

Interested students should set up a time to discuss rotation project ideas with Dr. Romano; he can be reached at joseph.romano [at] pennmedicine.upenn.edu.

Postdoctoral researchers:

We are looking to hire several postdoctoral researchers to work at the intersections of artificial intelligence and biomedicine. For more information on this research effort, see here. Successful candidates will have a PhD, MD, or equivalent doctoral degree by the time of their start date, and will have research experience in a quantitative field (including, but not limited to, biomedical informatics, computer science, systems biology, or biomedical engineering). Preference will be given to applicants with expertise in artificial intelligence and/or cheminformatics.

The initial appointment will be for 1 year with the potential for renewals given satisfactory performance. Postdocs will be expected to publish in peer-reviewed journals and present their work at national and international conferences.

Interested applicants should submit a CV, cover letter indicating their reserach interests, and names/contact information of 2 references to Dr. Romano at joseph.romano [at] pennmedicine.upenn.edu.

Full-stack developer:

A major part of the lab's research involves developing open access scientific databases and tools for interacting with those databases. We are hiring a full-time developer to maintain these resources and add new functionality relating to the lab's current and future research projects. Qualified candidates should have experience with the Python and Javascript programming languages, as well as modern database management systems. They will also be comfortable with at least one modern Javascript frontend web framework. Applicants with experience in graph databases will be given preference.

For a complete job description and online application, please see the full posting here.

Other roles:

Don't see a position above that fits? We're always on the lookout for highly motivated scientists and students at different levels of their academic career — contact us to set up a time to chat about possible opportunities!
